newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Implats expects balanced platinum market.
newsitem.headline: Implats expects balanced platinum market.

text.p: Impala Platinum Holdings Ltd (Implats) said on Thursday it expected Russian platinum sales not to be maintained at past levels which should lead to a balanced platinum market in the near future.

"Indications are that Russian platinum sales will not be maintained at the levels of the past few years and this should balance the market in the near future," Implats said in a statement accompanying year results.

The company, South Africa's second-largest platinum producer, said the delay in Russian deliveries created a "climate of uncertainty". "The anxiety created by the delay in Russian deliveries of platinum and palladium during the first half of 1997 has created a climate of uncertainty and users could be forced to review their strategic consumption of these metals," Implats said.
